revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Sitecom |model=WLR-6000 |ean=8716502023660 |asin=B005GX9WZA;GB; |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=Senao |fcc_date=01/04/2012 |fcc_id=U2M-WBR5200MGN |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.25 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=2.1 |pwr_barrel_len=9.5 |cpu1_brand=Ralink |cpu1_model=RT3883;RT3883F; |cpu1_cspeed=500 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=25L6406E |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5TU32M16DG-AC |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, unpopulated,, J12 |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT3883;RT3883F; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi2_chip1_model=RT5392;RT5392L |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model=AR8327 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |802dot11_protocols=abgn |addl_chips=5GHz Power Amplifier IC;SiGe;SE2537L;;3;,,, 2A, 18V Synchronous Rectified Step-Down DC/DC Converter;ITE Tech;IT7652M;;2;,,, 2A, 5V Step-Down DC/DC Converter;ITE Tech;IT7802M;;1;,,, 3A, 23V, 340kHz, Synchronous Step-Down DC/DC Converter;ZillTek;ZT7184S;;1; |stock_boot=U-Boot;1.1.3;Ralink 3.1.0.0; |stock_os=Linux;2.6.21;Ralink SDK 3.1.0.0 |tp_firmware=OpenWrt, |default_ssid=SitecomXXXXXX, |default_ssid_regex=^Sitecom[A-F0-9]{6}$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=''randomly generated'' |oui=64:D1:A3 |oui_eth=64:D1:A3 }} {{TagLine|Wireless Gigabit Router 750N X6}} [http://www.sitecom.com/en/wireless-gigabit-router-n750-x6/wlr-6000/p/359 Product page]
[http://www.sitecom.com/download/5022/WLR-6000-Full-Manual-English.pdf Manual] This device is presumed to be a ''Senao'' WBR5200MGN. It's noted in its FCC test report :(and the FCC EUT's board is silkscreened w/ text indicating it's a WLR-6000 v1). :The FCC ID of the WBR5200MGN has been assigned to this entry, but there is likely :(almost certainly..) no FCC ID on the device's label. Per the manual, the password is on the label of the device. *[http://www.madshrimps.be/articles/article/1000294/Sitecom-N750-X6-WLR-6000-Wireless-Gigabit-Router-Review/5# ''Sitecom N750 X6 WLR-6000 Wireless Gigabit Router Review''] *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/images/stories/wireless/engenius_esr750h/engenius_esr750h_fcc.jpg FCC - PCB]
